text: The food portion was so horrible and less. The price for the salted egg prawn ball is $20 and the portion you can see from my photo. The prawn paste chicken is $14 and totally not worth it. The assam fish is a bit oily. I will not patron the place again as the portion is not worth the price. We can get better food with generous portion. Pretty disappointed with the food.

Average experience. Kai Lan was quite bitter.

Dont think will come back again.
Recommended to try KL style Cantonese Yuan Yang. With crispy fried beehoon and kway teow stir fried beforehand, generous portion with excellent wok hey.

Food here is a 3.5/5.

Some days the food is incredibly good, other days it can be meh. It's a bit of a mixed bag, but I'd say most days the food is pretty good.

My subjective take is that the food tends to taste a bit lacklustre midweek, especially for the Thursdays lunch service. The portions on the lacklustre days also seem smaller than the norm.

Dishes here worth trying: the spare ribs; kong pow chicken; ginger and scallion pork; mee goreng; salted egg chicken (get the one with the added sauce); sliced fish soup.

In terms of service, well the eatery gets the job done ie ensure that you are fed at a reasonable price.

Quick tip: when ordering for take out at peak hours eg 11.30am to 1pm or 6pm to 7.30pm, be prepared to wait up to 40mins.
